description:
50. Temperance is the greatest of virtues. 自我节制是最大的美德。

51. Temperance is the greatest of virture. 自我节制是最大的美德。

52. That is a good book which is opened with expectation and closed with profit. 好书开卷引人入胜，闭卷使人得益。

53. That is not good language which all understand not. 不是人人都懂的语言不是好语言。

54. That teacher helps his pupils most who most helps them to help themselves. 教师尽力帮助学生独立工作是给学生最大的帮助。

55. That was indeed a pretty kettle of fish. 那真是糟糕透顶的事。

56. That which is evil is soon learnt. 恶行易学。

57. That which is striking and beautiful is not always good, but that which is good is always beautiful. 漂亮而引人注目的东西不一定都善良，但善良的东西总是漂亮的。

58. That which one least anticipates soonest comes to pass. 事非逆料偏易发生。

59. That which was bitter to endure may be sweet to remember. 苦楚往日难忍受，记起也许甜心头。

60. That\'s good wisdom which is wisdom in the end. 最后的聪慧才算真聪慧。

61. The (or A) beggar may sing before the thief (or footbad). 既是穷光蛋，何虑窃贼偷。

62. The abundance of money ruins youth. 钱多毁青年。

63. The ass wags his ears. 自鸣自得。

64. The bait hides the hook. 饵里藏钩；笑里藏刀。

65. The battle is to the strong. 强者必胜

title: 关于学习的英文谚语：恶行易学
